full_text: OBTS Number PROBABLE CAUSE AFFIDAVIT Agency ORI Number 1 Arrest 3 Request for Warrant 2 NTA 4 Request for Capa Juvenile FLC 5 0 0 6 0 0 Agency Name PALM BEACH POLICE DEPARTMENT Agency Report Number 7 6 1 0 5 1 0 0 1 2 6 3 1 0 2 4 Special Notes Charge Type Felony Traffic Felony Misdemeanor Ordinance Traffic Misdemeanor Other Charge Description Possession of MARYJANA Charge Description Possession of DRUG PARAPHERNALIA Victim's Name (Last, First, Middle) Local Address (Street, Apt Number) (City) (State) (Zip) Phone (State) (Zip) Phone Race Sex Date of Birth Address Source Occupation The undersigned certifies and swears that he/she has just and reasonable grounds to believe, and does believe that the above named Defendant committed the following violation of law. The Person taken into custody committed the below acts in my presence was observed by that he/she saw the arrested person commit the below acts. was found to have committed the below acts, resulting from my (described) investigation admitting to the below facts On the 11 day of SEPTEMBER 2005 at 1144 AM PM (Specifically include facts constituting cause for arrest.) on SUNDAY, SEPTEMBER 11, 2005, AT APPROXIMATELY 2306 HOURS, I OBSERVED A FOUR DOOR WHITE MITSUBISHI, FL TAG #CJ04VU PARKED IN A SAFETY ZONE WITHIN A CURVE IN THE ROADWAY, ACROSS FROM 760 NORM OCEAN BLVD. AS I DROVE UP BEHIND THE VEHICLE, THE VEHICLE LEFT THE SAFETY ZONE, WHICH I THEN CONDUCTED A CAR STOP ON THE 200 BLOCK OF BAHAMA LANE. UPON APPROACHING THE AUTO, I OBSERVED FIVE OCCUPANTS INSIDE THE CAR SEVERAL HAVING BLOODSHOT EYES. I ALSO DETECTED AN ODOR OF MARYJANA FROM INSIDE THE AUTO ALONG WITH OBSERVING THE OCCUPANTS APPEARING TO BE NERVOUS. I SPOKE WITH THE OCCUPANTS OF THE VEHICLE AND ASKED THEM IF THEY HAD MARYJANA, THE DEFENDANT informed me that SHE DID, SHOWING ME A CLEAR PLASTIC BAG CONTAINING MARYJANA, A BROWN PAPER BAG CONTAINING MARYJANA AND A GLASS PIPE CONTAINING MARYJANA RESIDUE. BOTH THE MARYJANA AND PARAPHERNALIA TESTED POSITIVE. BASED ON THE AFOREMENTIONED INCIDENT, I ARRESTED AND CHARGED WITH POSSESSION OF MARYJANA, F.S. 893.13(6)(B) AND POSSESSION OF DRUG PARAPHERNALIA, F.S. 893.147. (MARIJUANA WEIGHED AT 3.0 GRAMS) SWORN AND SUBSCRIBED BEFORE ME Sgt K BURFIELD NOTARY PUBLIC/COURT POLICE OFFICER 9-12-05 DATE Dice det SIGNATURE OF ARRESTING/INVESTIGATING OFFICER Vic NICHOLAS CALSO NAME OF OFFICER (PLEASE PRINT) 9/10/05 DATE 1 OF 1 PAGE DISTRIBUTION: WHITE - Court Copy GREEN - State Attorney YELLOW - Agency PINK - Agency 07/26/17 Page 6 of 102 Public Records Request No.: 17-295 DOJ-OGR-00031314

On the 11 day of SEPTEMBER 2005 at 1144 AM PM (Specifically include facts constituting cause for arrest.) on SUNDAY, SEPTEMBER 11, 2005, AT APPROXIMATELY 2306 HOURS, I OBSERVED A FOUR DOOR WHITE MITSUBISHI, FL TAG #CJ04VU PARKED IN A SAFETY ZONE WITHIN A CURVE IN THE ROADWAY, ACROSS FROM 760 NORM OCEAN BLVD. AS I DROVE UP BEHIND THE VEHICLE, THE VEHICLE LEFT THE SAFETY ZONE, WHICH I THEN CONDUCTED A CAR STOP ON THE 200 BLOCK OF BAHAMA LANE. UPON APPROACHING THE AUTO, I OBSERVED FIVE OCCUPANTS INSIDE THE CAR SEVERAL HAVING BLOODSHOT EYES. I ALSO DETECTED AN ODOR OF MARYJANA FROM INSIDE THE AUTO ALONG WITH OBSERVING THE OCCUPANTS APPEARING TO BE NERVOUS. I SPOKE WITH THE OCCUPANTS OF THE VEHICLE AND ASKED THEM IF THEY HAD MARYJANA, THE DEFENDANT informed me that SHE DID, SHOWING ME A CLEAR PLASTIC BAG CONTAINING MARYJANA, A BROWN PAPER BAG CONTAINING MARYJANA AND A GLASS PIPE CONTAINING MARYJANA RESIDUE. BOTH THE MARYJANA AND PARAPHERNALIA TESTED POSITIVE. BASED ON THE AFOREMENTIONED INCIDENT, I ARRESTED AND CHARGED WITH POSSESSION OF MARYJANA, F.S. 893.13(6)(B) AND POSSESSION OF DRUG PARAPHERNALIA, F.S. 893.147. (MARIJUANA WEIGHED AT 3.0 GRAMS)
Sgt K BURFIELD NOTARY PUBLIC/COURT POLICE OFFICER 9-12-05 DATE Dice det SIGNATURE OF ARRESTING/INVESTIGATING OFFICER Vic NICHOLAS CALSO NAME OF OFFICER (PLEASE PRINT) 9/10/05 DATE 1 OF 1 PAGE
DISTRIBUTION: WHITE - Court Copy GREEN - State Attorney YELLOW - Agency PINK - Agency

additional_notes: The document is a Probable Cause Affidavit from the Palm Beach Police Department, dated September 11, 2005. It details the arrest of a defendant for possession of marijuana and drug paraphernalia. The affidavit includes a handwritten statement from the arresting officer, Vic Nicholas Calso, describing the events leading to the arrest. The document is signed by Sgt K Burfield, a notary public/court police officer.
